Descriptions.Shields: Any character can freely wear a Shield, as long as the Stat requirements are met. While wearing a Shield, you can't use 2-Handed Weapons, but you can use 1-Action Abilities normally. Note that a Shield requires you to be out of combat to equip or unequip.
Descriptions.Runes:
Any weapon can be inscribed with 1 rune. A rune is destroyed when used to inscribe a weapon, and inscribing a rune onto a weapon replaces the previous rune (if there was any).
Standard runes (like the ones below) can be purchased from most regular stores.
Descriptions.One-Handed Melee: Any character can freely use any One-Handed Weapon, as long as the Stat requirements are met. Attacks with One-Handed Weapons only use a Half-Action, so you can make 2 attacks on your turn, even with the same weapon!
Descriptions.Two-Handed Melee: Any character can freely use any Two-Handed Weapon, as long as the Stat requirements are met. Attacks with Two-Handed Weapons use 1 Action.
Descriptions.One-Handed Ranged: Any character can freely use One-Handed Weapon, as long as the Stat requirements are met. Attacks with One-Handed Weapons only use a Half-Action, so you can make 2 attacks on your turn, even with the same weapon!
Descriptions.Two-Handed Ranged: Any character can freely use any Two-Handed Weapon, as long as the Stat requirements are met. Attacks with Two-Handed Weapons use 1 Action.

Shield.Effect: You take -50% Damage from ranged physical attacks
Shield.Notes:
Remember that you have to declare whether you have a Shield equipped when you start your turn!
Dual wielding Shields requires a Feat.
You can't use 2-Handed Weapons with a Shield.

Tower Shield.Notes:
Remember that you have to declare whether you have a Shield equipped when you start your turn!
Dual wielding Shields requires a Feat.
You can't use 2-Handed Weapons with a Shield.

Elemental Rune.Effect: Inscribe on a weapon to permanently change its Damage type to Fire, Cold or Shock.
Elemental Rune.Notes: This rune is consumed when inscribed, and overwrites the previous rune on the weapon if any.

Traditional Rune.Effect: Inscribe on a weapon to permanently remove its Stat requirements.
Traditional Rune.Notes: This rune is consumed when inscribed, and overwrites the previous rune on the weapon if any.

Mind Rune.Effect: Inscribe on a weapon to permanently replace one Stat in its text (e.g. Might) with Intelligence.
Mind Rune.Notes: This rune is consumed when inscribed, and overwrites the previous rune on the weapon if any.

Spirit Rune.Effect: Inscribe on a weapon to permanently replace one Stat in its text (e.g. Might) with Sense or Charisma.
Spirit Rune.Notes: This rune is consumed when inscribed, and overwrites the previous rune on the weapon if any.

Punch.Effect: Critical Strike - if you roll 4, also add your other Stat to the Damage.
Punch.Notes:
On a Critical Strike, if you used Might, you also add Dexterity to the roll (or vice-versa, if you used Dexterity, you also add Might).
If you used another Stat (certain weird Abilities do this), you add either Might or Dexterity, of choice.

Club.Effect: Critical Strike - if you roll 1 or 2, the Attack instantly makes the target Fumbling.

Hand Hammer.Notes: Does not scale with any Stat.

Sickle.Notes: The price is for a battle sickle. A normal peasant's sickle would be half the price, dealing 1 less damage.

Cleaver.Effect: Critical Strike - if you roll 6, add another 1d6 Damage, and you take 50% of all the attack's Damage.

Hand Axe.Effect: Critical Strike - if you roll 9 or 10 against a Worthy Enemy, heal for an amount equal to your Might or Dexterity (your choice).

Flail.Effect: You can choose to deal Smash Damage with this weapon. Deals 1d10 + 2 Damage instead if attacking a Unit with higher Initiative than you.
Flail.Notes: Does not scale with any Stat.

Shortsword.Effect: If you roll less than 3 on the d6, it counts as a 3.
Shortsword.Alternatives: Falchion, Sabre, Scimitar variant, Arming Sword

Dagger.Effect: Critical Strike - if you roll 3 or more the base weapon roll, add another 1d6 Damage.

Rapier.Effect: If you decide to start your turn with the other hand empty, you have 1 extra movement Speed and you can Break your Movement.

Scimitar.Special: You are more appreciated if you pronounce it as 'Skimitar'
Scimitar.Effect: If you roll 1 on the weapon die, cancel it and roll 1d8 instead. If you roll 1 again, reroll as 1d10. If you roll 1 again, reroll as 1d12.

Greatclub.Effect: Critical Strike - if all 4 rolled weapon dice are even, the target must succeed a Might Check against the sum of the dice or be Stunned.
Greatclub.Notes: If by any chance this weapon rolls more than 3 dice, the Critical Strike triggers if at least 3 of the rolled weapon dice are even.

Halberd.Effect: Has +1d6 Damage against Large or larger enemies.

Scythe.Effect: You can use 1 Action to just deal 8 Damage to all Units around you (against their Defense).
Scythe.Notes: The price is for a battle scythe. A normal peasant's scythe would be half the price and can't use the special effect.

Pike.Effect: Attacks with this weapon have 2 meters range.

Pickaxe.Effect: Deals +1d6 Damage against Units wearing a shield or heavy armor (or both).

Longsword.Effect: Critical Strike - if you roll 12, add Damage equal to 10% of the target's current Health!

Battle Axe.Effect: Critical Strike - if you roll 10 on at least one die, heal for the other rolled die (both from the base weapon roll) (only works against Worthy Enemies).

Heavy Mace.Effect: Critical Strike - if you did maximum Damage on the base weapon roll, push the target up to 4 meters in any direction. It takes another 1d4 Smash Damage if it collides with something.

Warhammer.Effect: Your first attack with this weapon every combat ignores the target's Resistances and Defense and permanently reduces it by 1.
Warhammer.Notes: Doesn't do extra Damage if target's Defense would be less than 0.

Greatsword.Effect: Add all 6's rolled together. They hit another Unit within 2 meters of the target for that amount.
Greatsword.Notes: Hitting another Unit with the d6's is optional.

Quarterstaff.Effect: If you are wearing no armor and wield only this weapon, you have +1 Defense.
Quarterstaff.Notes: A Quarterstaff is a wooden weapon masterfully crafted for physical combat, with correct weight and density and properly balanced; it's not a mage's walking stick!

Katana.Effect: Critical Strike - if you roll 4 on the d4, the Attack gains +1d10 Damage.

Trident.Effect: If you attack from at least 3 meters away from where you started your turn, the attack gains +3 Damage.

Ultra Greatsword.Effect: Critical Strike - if you roll 20, add 1d20 Damage!

Heavy Gun.Effect: For 1 Action, you can deal 8 Damage to all creatures in a 3x3 area in front of you.
Heavy Gun.Downside: After attacking, if you rolled at least one 1, the Heavy Gun jams, and must be reloaded with a Half-Action before using it again.
Heavy Gun.Notes: Attacks with this weapon do not add any Stat to the Damage. Using the special effect consumes 2 ammo.

Javelin.Notes: This weapon is baseline made for throwing.

Bow.Effect: Critical Strike - deal +1d8 extra Damage if you roll 8.

Handgun.Downside:
Has no penalty for attacking melee with this weapon.
If you roll at least one 1, the Handgun jams, and must be reloaded with a Half-Action before using it again.
Handgun.Notes: Handgun attacks do not scale with any Stat.

Boomerang Blade.Effect: Critical Strike - if you roll 12, the weapon bounces to another chosen Unit within 4 meters and Damages it for 1d12 + Your Dexterity Damage (against its Defense).
Boomerang Blade.Notes: The effect applies even to the bounce attack, so it can keep bouncing as long as you keep rolling 12!

Blowgun.Effect: If the target has 50% Health or less, the Damage Type becomes Poison and the target is Slowed.
Blowgun.Notes: The normal ammunition for this is the Regular Poison Darts (full supply). If your darts are somehow not poisoned, you don't apply the effect.

Light Crossbow.Effect: Critical Strike - if you roll 4, add 1d4 Damage!

Sling.Effect: Attacks with Slings use a Third-of-an-Action (0.33 Actions).
Sling.Notes: Yes, and you can attack 3 times per turn with the same sling. Abilities that require you to make a 1-Handed weapon attack will still take a Half-Action, even if the normal Sling attack would take 0.33 Actions
